publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-341 Mr Brian Monteith: Botticelli Painting for Glasgow—That the Parliament notes the purchase by the National Galleries of Scotland of Botticelli’s "The Virgin adoring the sleeping Christ Child" for the nation and calls upon the National Galleries of Scotland to exhibit this work of art initially at the Burrell Collection in Glasgow at the start of a Scottish tour before it begins its residence in the National Gallery of Scotland in Edinburgh. Supported by: Bill Aitken*, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*
S1M-341 Botticelli Painting for Glasgow (lodged on 1 December 1999) Mr Jamie McGrigor*

S1M-341 Mr Brian Monteith: Botticelli Painting for Glasgow—That the Parliament notes the purchase by the National Galleries of Scotland of Botticelli’s "The Virgin adoring the sleeping Christ Child" for the nation and calls upon the National Galleries of Scotland to exhibit this work of art initially at the Burrell Collection in Glasgow at the start of a Scottish tour before it begins its residence in the National Gallery of Scotland in Edinburgh. Supported by: Bill Aitken, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr Jamie McGrigor
S1M-341 Botticelli Painting for Glasgow (lodged on 1 December 1999) Mr David Davidson*

S1M-341 Mr Brian Monteith: Botticelli Painting for Glasgow—That the Parliament notes the purchase by the National Galleries of Scotland of Botticelli’s "The Virgin adoring the sleeping Christ Child" for the nation and calls upon the National Galleries of Scotland to exhibit this work of art initially at the Burrell Collection in Glasgow at the start of a Scottish tour before it begins its residence in the National Gallery of Scotland in Edinburgh. Supported by: Bill Aitken, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mr David Davidson

S1M-341 Mr Brian Monteith: Botticelli Painting for Glasgow—That the Parliament notes the purchase by the National Galleries of Scotland of Botticelli’s "The Virgin adoring the sleeping Christ Child" for the nation and calls upon the National Galleries of Scotland to exhibit this work of art initially at the Burrell Collection in Glasgow at the start of a Scottish tour before it begins its residence in the National Gallery of Scotland in Edinburgh. Supported by: Bill Aitken, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mr David Davidson

S1M-341 Mr Brian Monteith: Botticelli Painting for Glasgow—That the Parliament notes the purchase by the National Galleries of Scotland of Botticelli’s "The Virgin adoring the sleeping Christ Child" for the nation and calls upon the National Galleries of Scotland to exhibit this work of art initially at the Burrell Collection in Glasgow at the start of a Scottish tour before it begins its residence in the National Gallery of Scotland in Edinburgh. Supported by: Bill Aitken, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mr David Davidson

S1M-341 Mr Brian Monteith: Botticelli Painting for Glasgow—That the Parliament notes the purchase by the National Galleries of Scotland of Botticelli’s "The Virgin adoring the sleeping Christ Child" for the nation and calls upon the National Galleries of Scotland to exhibit this work of art initially at the Burrell Collection in Glasgow at the start of a Scottish tour before it begins its residence in the National Gallery of Scotland in Edinburgh. Supported by: Bill Aitken, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mr David Davidson
S1M-341 Botticelli Painting for Glasgow (lodged on 1 December 1999) Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*

S1M-341 Mr Brian Monteith: Botticelli Painting for Glasgow—That the Parliament notes the purchase by the National Galleries of Scotland of Botticelli’s The Virgin adoring the sleeping Christ Child for the nation and calls upon the National Galleries of Scotland to exhibit this work of art initially at the Burrell Collection in Glasgow at the start of a Scottish tour before it begins its residence in the National Gallery of Scotland in Edinburgh. Supported by: Bill Aitken, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mr David Davidson, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton

S1M-341 Mr Brian Monteith: Botticelli Painting for Glasgow—That the Parliament notes the purchase by the National Galleries of Scotland of Botticelli’s The Virgin adoring the sleeping Christ Child for the nation and calls upon the National Galleries of Scotland to exhibit this work of art initially at the Burrell Collection in Glasgow at the start of a Scottish tour before it begins its residence in the National Gallery of Scotland in Edinburgh. Supported by: Bill Aitken, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mr David Davidson, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton

S1M-341 Mr Brian Monteith: Botticelli Painting for Glasgow—That the Parliament notes the purchase by the National Galleries of Scotland of Botticelli’s The Virgin adoring the sleeping Christ Child for the nation and calls upon the National Galleries of Scotland to exhibit this work of art initially at the Burrell Collection in Glasgow at the start of a Scottish tour before it begins its residence in the National Gallery of Scotland in Edinburgh. Supported by: Bill Aitken, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Mr David Davidson, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton
